page.title: 02RELIGIOUS LIFE IN CLOPHILL
page.content: In former times{Clophill}had several small nonconformist chapels, most of which have now disappeared, but one is now used as an animal food shop. We have a ruined{12th century}church which in recent years has been well known nationally as a site for{black {magic,}especially on{Hallowe'en;}but this is no longer enacted. The site has been made into a beautiful picnic area. The present day{Places of Worship}are {St.Mary's Church,}built in the reign of Queen Victoria it incorporates a Lychgate and oak carvings from the old church, and the{Methodist Chapel}on the High Street which also holds a Sunday School for children. There is an interdenominational Christian Fellowship Group and a Meditation Group, both of which meet monthly.
